intro: Staurogyne caobangensis, commonly known as the Caobang Staurogyne, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
